alert.note: Alert for Iowa (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 25 at 1:10AM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Wisconsin, including the following county, Iowa. * WHEN...Until 415 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 110 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Highland, Avoca, Clyde and Blackhawk Lake Rec Area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
